text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with stuffed peppers simple and
delicious and this video is more of a
technique demonstration than an actual
recipe because to be honest I haven't
even finalized stuffing recipe yet but
here we go we're going to take some bell
peppers I'm using red you can use green
yellow orange whatever in fact I
actually be honest kind of like the
bitterness of the green in this recipe
but for aesthetics I'm going to use red
cut off a good half inch of the top but
be careful because we're going to use
these as lids so once you cut that off
go around with a paring knife take off
the stem and reserve the top we're going
to take out all the seeds you can use a
spoon you can use in melon baller to get
out the little membranes there but you
don't want any seeds left in there and
then just a very little trim on the
bottom just to make it sit straight I
actually like to poke a couple holes to
let the juices up in there alright so go
ahead and clean out 6 bell pepper I'm
also going to slice up half an onion
really thin because these are going to
roast and braise on tapas and tomato
sauce so I have a cup and a half of any
kind of tomato sauce 1/2 a cup of beef
broth some red pepper flakes you know I
like it spicy and then my thinly
slivered onions alright give that a toss
give that a mix you want to throw a big
pinch of salt in there go ahead not a
bad idea of course any other types of
herbs or flavorings is encouraged set
your bell peppers in that's a 9 by 13
baking dish by the way now for the
filling I'm going to take a pound and a
half of ground meat now here anything
works lamb pork half sausage half beef
fantastic but a pound and a half of some
type of ground meat lots of salt of
course some fresh garlic fresh parsley
some black pepper freshly grated
Parmesan cheese a couple tablespoons of
the tomato sauce we're going to give
that a mix just until barely combined
and then I'm going to stir in my cooked
rice in fact 94% of stuffed bell peppers
are made because there's leftover raised
around true story alright so leftover
rice cup and a half
you can cook it to make it leftover
we're going to give that a mix we're
going to fill the peppers with the
stuffing mixture it should be just
enough to fill six to the top
depending on the size don't get mad if
it's slightly off because I don't know
how big your peppers are come on give me
a break all right we're going to put
another spoon of sauce over each one
spread that out put the tops on aren't
those cute like little lids I'm going to
put a piece of parchment paper down just
because I don't like foil touching
acidic things when it bakes probably
would be okay I would put a little
parchment paper down or wax paper then
some foil that's going to go in a
375-degree oven for an hour now you
notice I put mine on a sheet pan because
it's easier to get in and out of the
oven that also insulates it and that
also makes it take longer so if you
don't use that pan underneath yours is
going to take less time but after an
hour they were just starting to soften
up I took off the foil I put them back
in for about 20 minutes to a half-hour
until the meats cooked which it will be
but more importantly the pepper has to
be tender soft sweet tender and that's
it little fresh parsley on top you serve
them with some of the juice from
underneath spooned over and you can
adjust this recipe in lots of different
places the herbs the meats you use like
I said hot pepper and so forth so that's
the technique knock yourself out coming
up with some amazing fillings and give
those beautiful stuffed peppers are try
anyway go to the site get all the
ingredients and as always enjoy
